title: If H and O are the orthocenter and circumcenter of triangle ABC where angle B is 45 degrees and angle C is 30 degrees, what is angle HAO in degrees? - Quora

response.answer_text: We put A at [math](0,2)[/math] and BC along the X axis, so [math]B(-2,0)[/math] and [math]C(2\sqrt{3},0)[/math] to get the required angles. The x axis is the altitude to A, so the orthocenter H is on it; we see it’s above A at the meet of the green altitudes; we don’t need any more detail. The circumcenter O is the meet of the pink perpendicular bisectors. N is the midpoint of BC, so coordinates [math](\sqrt{3}-1,0).[/math] M is the midpoint of AB, so [math](-1,1);[/math] MO has slope -1 so is [math]y-1=-(x+1)[/math] or [math]y=-x.[/math] O is the meet, so O is [math](\sqrt{3}-1,-\sqrt{3}+1).[/math] AO has slope [math]m = \dfrac{-\sqrt{3}+1 - 2}{\sqrt{3}-1} = -\dfrac{\sqrt{3}+1}{\sqrt{3}-1}\cdot \dfrac{\sqrt{3}+1}{\sqrt{3} + 1} =-\dfrac{4+2\sqrt{3}}{2} = -2-\sqrt{3}[/math] We recognize [math]m[/math] as [math]-\tan (30^\circ + 45^\circ) = - \dfrac{ \tan 30 + \tan 45 }{1 - \tan 30 \tan 45} = -\dfrac{1/\sqrt{3} + 1}{1 - 1/\sqrt{3}} = -\dfrac{1+\sqrt{3}}{\sqrt{3}-1}=-2-\sqrt{3}[/math] [math]\angle HAO = 90^\circ -  \arctan m = 90^\circ - -75^\circ = 165^\circ[/math] Answer: [math]165^\circ[/math]

HAO = HAA’ + A’AO = 180 + A’AO A’AO = BAC - BAA’ - OAC BAC = 180 - 45 - 30 = 105 (angle measure are in degree) B=45 so AOC = 90 and OAC = 45 BAA’ = 180 - 90 - 45 = 45 A’A0 = 105 - 45 - 45 = 15 HAO = 180 + 15 = 195 [mod 360] which can also be -165
I think the answer is 7.5 degrees, but I may be wrong…
